quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Lives of great men all remind us, we can make our lives sublime, and, departing, leave behind us, footprints on the sands of time.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

quote: Nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: Behind every great fortune lies a great crime.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: To achieve great things, two things are needed; a plan, and not quite enough time.
author: Leonard Bernstein

quote: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I am the greatest, I said that even before I knew I was.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

quote: To become truly great, one has to stand with people, not above them.
author: Montesquieu

quote: You are your greatest asset. Put your time, effort and money into training, grooming, and encouraging your greatest asset.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually fearing that you'll make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself; to be conquered by yourself is of all things most shameful and vile.
author: Plato

quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength; and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A great man is different from an eminent one in that he is ready to be the servant of the society.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

quote: There is no greatness where there is no simplicity, goodness and truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

quote: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness, but it is greatness.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other's eyes for an instant?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: The great question that has never been answered, and which I have not yet been able to answer, despite my thirty years of research into the feminine soul, is 'What does a woman want?'
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The greatest mistake we make is living in constant fear that we will make one.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: See everything, overlook a great deal, correct a little.
author: Pope John XXIII

quote: We grow small trying to be great.
author: E. Stanley Jones

quote: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.
author: Mencius

quote: Believe deep down in your heart that you're destined to do great things.
author: Joe Paterno

quote: Don't be humble... you're not that great.
author: Golda Meir

quote: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.
author: William Blake

quote: To have great poets, there must be great audiences.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Good artists copy, great artists steal.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You need a little bit of insanity to do great things.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Only passions, great passions can elevate the soul to great things.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: The greater the artist, the greater the doubt. Perfect confidence is granted to the less talented as a consolation prize.
author: Robert Hughes

quote: The greater the effort, the greater the glory.
author: Pierre Corneille
